TopicTitle: Least Delta-V To Space (pm me if this has already been done)

Articles.Content:
Basically, a challenge I just came up with to accompany the "Fastest Mission to Space and Back" challenge. Basically, get to 70,000m in the least amount of delta-v possible.

RULES:

1. No cheating.

2. Stock only.

3. Pics or it didn't happen.

Here's my entry:

ONE SRB, a SAS unit, and a chair, to interplanetary space, made just after 0.21 came out.
I don't think this is a viable challenge, as the minimum amount of D/V to get into orbit is fixed. How about a minimum part count challenge?

Oh, exploitable!

Serioulsy. We should "get to 70.000 meters" not to the orbit?

Also, it can be interesting to see how much delta-v will be ACTUALLY used. Not an assumption, but the real numbers.

Probably we will get interesting ascent profiles or solutions...

But this is only in case the challenge itself gets fixed.

70 km in least delta-v is different question. However, it is more of the question of optimal movement through the stock soupmosphere, without spending too much on drag and too much on gravity fight.

Anyway, seems interesting. (Am actually going to take part in it)

However, a question: Can we use KER pretty please to count delta-v, or we should make it manually?

EDIT:

Here goes my entry: 2309 delta-v for 70 km altitude:

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited September 16, 2014 by [ELF]
Sea-level delta-V, vacuum delta-V, or actual expenditure? And if the third, do you know a way to record it?
^^ MechJeb has record widgets with expended, drag, gravity loss and steer loss dv, make a panel with those and you'll see it.
